elements.title: Alexander Caulfield Anderson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alexander Caulfield Anderson (pictured) was the first European to widen and use the Naches Pass?

elements.title: Deja Vu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olivia Rodrigo and Dan Nigro wrote the song "Deja Vu" within one day?

elements.title: Anita Rivas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Anita Rivas, an Ecuadorian mayor, visited the United Kingdom and offered to stop oil drilling in a rainforest in Yasuní National Park?

elements.title: United Nations special envoy on Myanmar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the mission of the United Nations special envoy on Myanmar has been called a "diplomatic graveyard"?

elements.title: Robert Byron Tabor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Robert Byron Tabor's first major painting was put on display in the White House by Franklin D. Roosevelt and his wife?

elements.title: there are nearly 100 carillons in Belgium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there are nearly 100 carillons in Belgium, two of which are in the same building?

elements.title: Deutsches Romantik-Museum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Deutsches Romantik-Museum in Frankfurt, the only museum dedicated to the entire era of German Romanticism, looks like three houses and features blue elements?

elements.title: Robert M. Blizzard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Robert M. Blizzard, who pioneered growth hormone therapy in children, liked to joke that he had added 11 miles (18 km) to the height of the U.S. population?
